Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel22309
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel! I was very pleasantly surprised when we entered the hotel room... or should I say apartment! It was decorated to the hilt and had a wonderful balcony view of the bay. I really thought for the price, we would get a flea bag compared to the prices of the other hotels around, but it was nothing of the sort. The linen was fresh, the beds were comfortable, it had a better kitchen in it than I have at home (granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, etc.) and the furniture/artwork was extremely stylish. The bathrooms were average but roomy and clean. I could have stayed here for a week but had to catch a cruise ship!! Very close commute to the Port of Miami (they offer shuttle service upon request for a small fee per person). The only thing I found possibly wrong was what others have commented on... breakfast was for 2 and I had 5 in my family, so had to pay an additional $13 for each of the kids, but we would have spent that at a restaurant so it was not a problem. Just know that going into it and it's all fine. The front desk were rather standoffish, but helpful when asked. This could be their attempt at being professional, but it came across as rather unapproachable. Once again, just a small factor in an overall WONDERFUL stay!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service,and dishonesty”
Reviews.Author: Joe c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fortune House from dec 23 2011 to January 3 2012.There were times that the maid came to clean the place at 7 pm ,and because we had a baby this became a major setback.On the first day i noticed that the door lock was falling off and called front desk,when the service person showed did't speak english.And when i checked out, i paid the full amont in cash,the bill was closed and was told that has been paid in full.Then later they charged my Am.Express card without my authorization.We paid a nightly fee of 20 us dollars for parking,and everytime we needed the car, had to wait for a long time.Overall a bad experience,i will never stay at this place again,nor will recommend it to anybody.J.Coimbra

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Hatter_in_Turks
Reviews.Content: FlyguyUk is correct in saying they are privately owned condos which means varying standards. We four girls needed a spacious place for a couple for nights before going on a cruise.We needed bathrooms,bedrooms and near the port,It was perfect for this.it is situated in Financial district with Publix supermarket and places to eat a few blocks away.Reasonably priced with two free breakfasts.Staff do not speak very good English which means confusion over food orders and front desk arrangements.Don't expect hotel service and all will be fine. Cleanliness varies as do room views and space.One couple complained to us of cockroach droppings and human hair in bed!We had upgraded onto 23rd floor and had great view of skyscrapers,sea,.Had new bathrooms with good showers, granite in kitchen and stainless steel appliances,plus crockery and cutlery.Quiet.Cleaner did not arrive to make beds till 5 p.m.It was fine for our needs.Airport to hotel was around $26-$30 depending on traffic.Pool on 6th floor is in shadow most of time and pigeon poo everywhere as they have taken up residency there.I did not fancy swimming with them as they preened themselves in the water..you cannot walk to a beach but nice stroll along the water's edge for photos.Close to free metro too. .

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyUK
Reviews.Content: This is primarily a residential property in which some owners rent their condos through a managing agent. I am not sure that the checkin staff are pleased with this arrangement as the service can feel rather haphazard. My unit, 2209, felt like a spacious one-bedroom apartment with a pleasant city view. The upkeep was very lacking however: cracked floor tiles, mismatched cheap and slightly tatty furniture, rusted doors, and paint blotches on the dark carpet (which hadn't been vacuumed in ages; I made two requests to housekeeping to do so on my second day). The trick here is to request a modern, well-renovated unit. It is potluck really as each owner has their own idea of what is a pleasing, comfortable place. The breakfast is plentiful and in a nice environment. There is a well-equipped gym and a small pool, although not recommended for sunbathing as the many tall buildings surrounding the property block the sun. The free, yes free!, metromover stop is only 2 blocks away; one can marvel at the tangible improvements in downtown Miami whilst riding to Bayside or to connect to a South Beach bus from the centre. Notice: they charge a daily 'facilities charge' here (plus tax) which is on top of any prepayment made through a booking website. Most sites avoid prominently mentioning this.

Reviews.Title: “Miami, FL getaway”
Reviews.Author: hecat
Reviews.Content: My favorite part & service of this stay was the bellmen & valet service. Gustavo & Sebastian were superb with their service, direction and hospitality. Not a bad location but a car is necessary to explore Miami. Our 2 bedroom apt was fine. The buffet breakfast included in our package was limited and the hot food warm at best. Would most likely not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: terrypeter155004
Reviews.Content: Had two different rooms booked, for a total of 8 people, The location was great, close to the people mover. The front staff was very helpful, Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Fortune House”
Reviews.Author: mikellh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fortune House for one night in January, 2012 before a cruise. It is a good, central location in downtown Miami. There was a Publix within walking distance although we had to ask for directions because it is down a side street. This is not a standard hotel. Rather, it is a condominium unit which has full-time residents. The rooms and surroudnings were clean and the lobby actually smelled like soap. The rooms are definitely spacious and the full kitchen was a bonus. There was also a washer and dryer (although we didn't use it because we had just arrived in town). We ate lunch in the hotel lobby restaurant. Service was extremely slow and we were limited to what type of alcoholic beverages we could order because the bartender wasn't on duty. My only complaint is upon arriving home our credit card had a separate charge from the Fortune House for $7.49. I called the hotel and they explained the charge was for the mini-bar. I told that we didn't use the mini-bar but we had noticed that there were 2 Coke bottles in the trash can when we arrived in the unit. They took my name and number and said they would get back to me. I waited two days and no one returned my call. I called again this morning and was assured that someone would look into it and get back to me. Hopefully they call me back and refund the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerald H
Reviews.Content: Good central location. Great ocean view. Breakfast was nice. The hotel service was really good. And I liked the pool very much.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than expected.”
Reviews.Author: Blair M
Reviews.Content: We had two â€œroomsâ€� which are actually apartments. One was single bedroom and the other had two bedrooms. The apartments were well equipped with a full kitchen (but no kettle in either apartment!) and two bathrooms in the two bedroom apartment. The pressure in one of the showers in the two bedroom apartment could have stripped paint off a car. If you want a hotel that is close to the action in Miami, this is not the place for you. Whilst there are restaurants and some shops nearby the majority are a 10-15 minute ride on the free Metromover away, this is fine during the day and evening but it stops operation around midnight. Overall this hotel was great value for money. **Visited March 2010**

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel... Bed Bugs... Filthy... Noisy... Blood Stains on bed”
Reviews.Author: alicat73
Reviews.Content: My SO and I stayed one night in Miami at Fortune House - it's the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The run down - as we pulled up to the Valet, Miami police officers were entering the building. That should have been a sign. Not sure what the problem was. During our check in, the front desk clerk kept stalling our check in procedure to help other guests who would randomly approach the counter to inquire on different things. Finally, we went up to the room and was surprised to see a kitchen en suite - and more surprised to see stark cold accomadation for $189 per night. Then the tiled floors - filthy, sticky. Bedroom carpeting - my toes curled just looking at it. I did not remove my shoes the entire time. Furnishings in the place looked second hand and run down. A dirty "suede" sofa pushed right up to a tv, make shift dining room with wrought iron dining chairs. I did not venture into the kitchen for fear that I would lose sleep over what I would see. The bathroom had an odd smell to it that resembled roach spray. The bathroom drain and the sink drain were clogged. I could not stand in the shower to bathe properly for fear of what would come back up through the drain. THEN,,, bed time. The bed was hard and lumpy, the pillows were of cheap foam. The sheets were the rough and there was one flat sheet on the bed with one coverlette. When I pulled back the coverlette... a DRIED BLOODSTAIN on the back end of the coverlette. I freaked out, so disgusted. pushed the coverlette onto the floor and tried to contain my emotions because we were both VERY tired after driving a long way from Key West. We laid down to sleep and then the dog barking started. The accomadation seems to be mixed with rentals and suites so you have permanent residents in the building with dogs. Between listening to 3 different dogs bark and hearing a man shout at his dog to "shut the f-up" I was on the brink of finally falling asleep when the shouting and fireworks began outside The next morning I came to find small red itching bites on both my arms and upon inspection of my luggage I have discovered bed bugs. What ever you do, do not stay here. It's not all that inexpensive when you consider we paid $189 through expedia for the room, an additional $20 for valet (there is no other option for parking) and I have incurred an additional $100 expense to have my clothes dry cleaned because of the bed bug infestation in the apartment. I still don't know what to do with my suitcase.. do I throw it out? We basically rented someones ill kept, filthy, bed bug infested apartment for $300 (all expenses accrued). You will REGRET it if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: Rtotoli
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 months and it was the worst experience that I ever had. Terrible service that never attended what we requested, unprepared recepcionists, manager that never answered any questions, recurrent internet and TV problems and even my wife's robe vanished when one of the ladies cleaned up the apartment. That is stealing and nobody did anything about that!! Unfortunately, I have one more week to stay there, but I wish I was gone already. Another thing: service is mostly in Spanish, so they could not understand our requests properly.

Reviews.Title: “...not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mountaingirl41
Reviews.Content: Fortune House is more like older apartments. Didn't feel the "hotel thing" and amenities at ALL. It did look like they were in the process of remodeling some areas. We stayed on the 7th floor and our friends stayed on the 17th. Our apartment was old appliances, furniture, pretty run-down.On the other hand, our friends apartment on the 17th floor was totally stunning! It was newly remodeled, new furniture and appliances,etc. and the balcony view, breathtaking! Breakfast and it's staff was good but could NOT take any of it, not even coffee, back to your room! The employees at front desk came off clueless and could use some social skills. We left scratching our heads about this confusing stay. If you MUST stay here, ask for a newly remodeled, upper suite/apartment. Do eat breakfast and don't expect much service otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you hate yourself!”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: You are better off staying at a Motel 6, rather than staying in this "hotel". I had booked a suite for two nights at the hotel, and was assigned a room on the pent house level. After traveling for business over a span of about 40 years, I thought I had seen everything. However, this hotel provided me with another reference point for the term "Hell". The only item that I can truly grade as "good", was the valet service. The room was furnished by IKEA! If you think I'm joking, then guess again. It was really furnished by IKEA. The bed was not provided with a box spring, under the mattress, and was lumpy and provided no support. The pillow were also lumpy, so I guess they were a matched pair. After one night on this bed, I had a sore back and neck. The sheets were not fitted, and of course moved around the mattress. The lamps were second hand I think, and were about one foot high. The ceiling fan did not work. The television's did not work, and also had no controller's, which also made sense then. The furniture in the living room also came from IKEA, and was dirty as well. The front door to the room was loose, and not secured. The bathroom had one light fixture, of which one bulb was out. There was no vent fan, and no air movement. So the only way to cool the bathroom down and remove the fog from the mirror was by waving the door back and forth for about 3-4 minutes. This was not great, due to the quality of the food in the restaurant. "DO NOT EAT IN THE RESTAURANT", if you want to stay friends with your digestive system, and not upset your wife. Trying to see the city with a colon that want's to commit suicide is not a good idea. This restaurant would be a better alternative than water boarding in my opinion. The United Nation's should also investigate the hotel for trying to pack a large number of people into a small area for the free breakfast. People were having to stand and eat, because of the lack of tables and chairs, and being told that they would be charged if they tried to take the plate and cup to their room to eat. Have you ever seen how people are packed into a subway during rush hour? Even though I had paid for two night's, I checked out after the one. My back and my stomach just couldn't take a second night at this place. Quote the Raven, "Never More"

Reviews.Title: “I left early”
Reviews.Author: qchristensen
Reviews.Content: This place is good if you want an apartment or some place to stay with your frat buddies. As a hotel it does pretty poorly. The internet didn't work in my room and the rest of the floor too. The bed comforter smelled like a wet dog and I had bad allergies. The furniture in the room is cheap and worn. The front desk staff don't really take responsibility for anything or try to fix things. I left after one night, which was four days early. The front desk didn't really care or bother to ask why.

Reviews.Title: “Good size suite”
Reviews.Author: Lycetts
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way in downtown, but very convenient to the monorail. Our suite was very spacious and had good cooking and laundry facilities. Good service at the restaurant, but a little disappointed the staff were unable to tell us much about what was happening locally or advise on things to do, transport, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - Beware of the deceptive practices”
Reviews.Author: Jose T
Reviews.Content: Got my confirmation 2 months ago. Got there on Sat 10/30/11 at 3PM and told me all 120 suites were "occupied" therefore there are no rooms availlable. Seriously, who's going to believe that??? So they put me and my wife in a one bedroom "Hotel Urbano" which is down the street. There is nothing wrong about Hotel Urbano if you are looking for a 2 star hotel, but I was expecting to be in a "executive suite". In all, be very careful about this hotel. Don't want anyone else to get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage was the kitchen in every suite. This was particularly important for me as I preferred to cook something after eating lots of restaurant food. The fact that the room also had laundry facilities helped immensely as I have been travelling for last couple of weeks and did not really get a chance to do the laundry.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay. Condo at hotel rates.”
Reviews.Author: highroller21
Reviews.Content: We booked this through expedia and were very surprise to get a condo. It was decorated very nicely and had great amenitities. I enjoyed complimentary breakfast every morning in the restaurant. The staff is people friendly and tries to make your stay pleasurable. I had a opportunity to meet the owners and they are trying to get up to 5 star qualities. They are willing to listen and answer questions. These condos are independently owned and are the decor varies. Friday nights happy hour is nice. I will stay everytime here when in Miami. I love concept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tammyfierce
Reviews.Content: I booked the Fortune House hotel for a one night stay because I was going on a cruise the next day. The Condo was so clean and cozy and everything from the flat screen to the bed to the furniture was updated. My son who is 2 years old just loved the place. The staff was accomodating and friendly and the breakfast buffet in the morning was spot on. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it........we will be back”
Reviews.Author: kitty146574
Reviews.Content: location was horrible but the price and rooms were great

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jgiaco
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned with the different reviews and what I was actually going to see at check in but I must say that I was very pleased. Large/clean rooms, easy access- all around good hotel for the price. The only down side was the dining area/bar- pricey, not great service but there are plenty of options near by

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, SHOCKING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Jordan34438
Reviews.Content: All the benefits of a great location and decent rooms are negated by the utterly dreadful service. The air of the front desk staff is of complete disdain towards the paying guest. Some examples: - it took 5 hours and 4 visits to reception to get bedding for our 3 year old's bed; - and 3 trips to the front desk to organise car hire; - of 3 taxis requested, 1 didn't turn up, 1 was 30 mins late and only a 3rd was on time; - we were double charged for valet parking, and billed twice for the hotel room itself; - on multiple occasions front desk staff made telephone calls mid-conversation

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: susiesan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fortune House for one night Feb. 25 before a cruise. I booked directly with the hotel and got the best rate. I booked the least expensive one bedroom unit and we got placed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit on the 9th floor. it was in excellent condition, looked like it had just been upgraded and remodeled. Everything was new. Big flat screen TV on the wall, fast free wifi internet. I had asked them to comp us the breakfast buffet and they did. I did not use the kitchen or washer/dryer. Location was good for walking to Mary Brickell Center for dinner, and to stores to pick up liquor to take on the ship. We also walked to the Metro train to visit Vizcaya in the morning before going to the ship. if I was to ever spend more time in Miami on a vacation or business I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: AnnOmaha_NE
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the same qualities as a motel 6, nothing fancy and just OK. The furnishings were well worn, the floor and walls showed definite wear, the kitchen was nothing fancy. However, it worked for us. We needed two rooms, and the price was very reasonable. The location was great for going on a cruise the next day. The restaurant and entry were very nice and clean. I think next time I would spring for something a bit nicer. If you are looking for something utilitarian, this is it. Just think Motel 6 with bigger accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “dog poop in hallway”
Reviews.Author: ortleybeachgirl
Reviews.Content: we had three units for the night before a cruise, none spotless but none filthy either. one was sparsely furnished, one had better furnishings and a fantastic view, the third was very well furnished and decorated and had a good view. anyway, as we walked to our units after dinner, there was a huge pile of dog poop in the middle of the hallway. my grandson was furious and knocked on a couple of doors. one was answered by a 5-year old home alone! except for his dog!! there was also a dog in another unit. we complained to the management and they pretty quickly cleaned it up. can you believe an owner or visitor would not clean up after their pet; not management's fault but we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying here again for sure”
Reviews.Author: jdrandel
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at BW's quite frequently. We had a wedding at right across the street. But, i refuse to pay the rates the wanted there. Fortune house was a pleasant experience. Six adults had no problem in this 2 bedroom apt. I felt quite "up town" I did see a few real tiny white or tan ants on the kitchen counter, but they did not go for our food. Hey your in Florida... We cooked dinner & breakfast over our 3 day 2 night stay, no critter problems. There was a very nice snack tray and drinks in the fridge upon arrival... but beware...the charge you a pretty penny for them. We loaded up at publix for the weekend. The service was prompt, and all our request were met. The pool was impecably clean & I am sure it had a salt water filtration system (very nice). I paid approx $334... across the street was real nice and very posh, but it would have cost me close to $2,000. This place will remain on my radar or sure.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is excellent. The only problem is the bed quality.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: Pros: The room is really big (like an apartament), with equiped kitchen, laundry machine inside the room, closet and a spetacular shower. It's located in miami downtown 5 minutes from Bayside Marketplace (by car). Breakfast is OK. Cons: The bed is really terrible. The wi-fi connection is either bad. The parking lot is $20 per day. It's a good hotel to stay long periods since the room looks like an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away; dirty and poor service.”
Reviews.Author: cd2010tn
Reviews.Content: We stayed the one night before a business meeting. The room was spacious and had a refrigerator. The microwave was broken. Carpet was filthy ,bugs seen in the room, sheets on the bed were too small. If you like a view it is nice. Tried to offer two other rooms were just as dirty. One room reaked of cigarette and cigar smoke. OK if you are into one night stands this is the hotel for you. Security to rooms is poor

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, BEAUTIFUL VIEWS, EXCELLENT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: ByKkL
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading the other reviews I was a bit hesitant to book my stay, but my group had already made reservations. We were heading on a cruise t and we needed an affordable place to stay that was nearby to the port. As we arrived, we were greeted by an extremely helpful staff that assisted with all of our luggage. We arrived an hour before check-in time, and our rooms were ready for us. As we headed to our rooms, we were required to swipe a key in order to call the elevator for security reasons (this made me feel very safe since only tenants and guests carry the access card). We reserved a two bedroom suite and as we went into the rooms, we were extremely impressed at the size of the suite and how tastefully decorated it was. It's actually an apartment with a full size kitchen, living area and a balcony with ocean view. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant and they had a great buffet set-up at an affordable price. I was pleased with my stay and would definitely recommend this hotel. We travel to Miami every year and would enjoy staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Bed Bugs, Disgusting Rooms, No Service, Stonewalling”
Reviews.Author: thehegemon
Reviews.Content: The worst experience I have ever had at any hotel. Part of my Affidavit regarding the Hotel: "The following documentation is to justify the first claim that the hotel was dangerous, infested with bugs, extremely dirty and unsafe in direct violation of health standards and our expectation. There was pubic hair on the floor and the rooms smelled of sewage. In addition, we were unable to change rooms and were unable to really even sleep in the room we were given. We were also unable to give our daughter a shower or shower ourselves since the bathtub and bathroom was unsanitary and was filled with mildew and mold. In addition the toiled did not work properly. In the morning we were both badly bitten by bed-bugs which also diminished the rest of our trip. Below are photoâ€™s showing our room and some of the issues and unsanitary, unsafe conditions we experienced. If requested I can also send video footage. These photos were taken when we first arrived in the room and shows the state of the room immediately upon our arrival." Also, Please be warned, if you have any issues they will always say the hotel manager is in a meeting and then never reutrn your call. Additional information from affidavit: "She [hotel clerk] said that she would have to ask the hotel manager to call me later in the day and that I did not have to sign the bill until the issue was resolved. I did not sign the final bill, nor did I agree to the final charges. The hotel manager never called me as per my verbal agreement with the front-desk receptionist and I attempted to call them on the dates listed below. Each time I called, I was told the manager was unavailable and the receptionist promised that the manager would return my call later that day to resolve the issue. The hotel manager never called me back. I have included copies of my phone records as evidence that I made the calls and that the hotel refused to respond to the attempts to contact them. 3/21/2010 later in day â€“ attempted to call hotel, hotel manager was unavailable 3/28/2010 Called Hotel, left message for hotel manager to call back 3/30/2010 Called Hotel left message for manager to call back 4/1/2010 8:30 am PST Called hotel left message for manager to call back " Upon request I have videos that show just how awful this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and dirty”
Reviews.Author: c0nman
Reviews.Content: There for 3 nights. Toilet dirty when I came and was never cleaned. They did come fix the A/C. Furniture is frat house and shabby. Rugs filthy and were never vacuumed. Second night room wasn't cleaned until 5pm. No soap for the dishwasher. Location okay, nothing great. Front desk folks were nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and excellent value for this location”
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Cabarete
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on TA, we made reservations for the Fortune House with a lot of doubts but we needed a place to stay in the Brickell and the photos and price of the Fortune House looked very good to us. We rented a two-bedroom Bay view suite and requested one bedroom with two twin beds. This was a family trip (parents and sisters). Unfortunately, we arrived at different times, after our parents, who had accepted our reservation with two queen beds instead. We were told they were going to move us but never did, so one of us had to sleep in the couch. No big deal for us but keep this in mind if you need two twins. Our apartment (this is a condominium partially managed as a hotel) was very nice, with white ceramic tile floors, modern and tasteful furniture, and a modern kitchenette with nice looking appliances. Two of us stayed for two weeks, so this was important although we didn't actually cook. Bathrooms were okay, spacious and comfortable for a long stay. Bedrooms were rather small. Dinning kitchen area very good size. Flat screen TVs in bedrooms and living room. Very nice bay area from the balcony; unfortunately there was no patio furniture in the balcony--something I missed. The gym was good, nice size, but older equipment. The pool area very nice and comfortable. They provide you with clean towels as well as fresh water with lemon slices. What was not very good was housekeeping. Granted, there was daily maid service, but do not expect much cleaning. The maids will not make your bed but just tidy it up, clean the bathroom and change your towels (not necessarily for a full set of towels--my hand towel or floor mat was many times missing) and put dirty dishes in the dishwasher. You will return to a place with dirty dishes if you do not bring any dishwashing liquid with you. Floors were not swept or otherwise cleaned in the two weeks that we were there. No dusting furniture either even though I made sure that the tables were empty so that they could clean. Wi-Fi is available but very unreliable. At least in our floor (25) the signal was very weak, would disconnect me every few minutes, and when it worked, it was very slow. Breakfast for two persons was included (only my parents registered, that may be why). Parking is not included; $20 a day if you are staying in the hotel; $5 a day if you're a visitor. We couldn't understand the parking policy. If you come in once a day and leave once a day, you're a visitor. If you are staying in the hotel and come in/out also once a day you're considered a resident. Front desk service was very good. All the staff was very courteous. The hotel is located on a side street between the Four Seasons and the Conrad. Five to six blocks from a grocery store, Walgreens and a BP gas station. Seven blocks from the Mary Brickell area. Many good restaurant just a couple of blocks away. I'm recommending this hotel based on value and location. You cannot beat their prices in the Brickell area. If you need Wi-Fi for work, I would not recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honest007
Reviews.Content: This hotel from the outside looks good, but when we got to the 2 bedroom condo i discover tiny little ants everywhere, i was so upset because i had a 2 year old and a 3 month old, they moved us to a different one and i felt better, but when i check again i found those tiny ants everywhere. We did not have another choice but to stay and i did not sleep at all i cried every day and i pray for time to go fast so we could leave. The staff not nice, they do not care, do not choose this hotel, it is worse than horrible!.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hunter8512
Reviews.Content: My girlriends and I booked this hotel for two nights! As soon as we checked in we wanted to leave! The room was supposed to accomodate 5 adults and all we got was two double beds. We called the front desk and they could care less. It was a penthouse suite and it was filthy. Our socks were black from walking on the floors. There were hair clips, pins and all kinds of debris on the rugs. The room was freezing and we called and ask for more blankets we were told they didn't have any! They brought us these beaten up cots for a couple of us to sleep on. They were rude and did not care if we were unhappy or not. We stayed up all night looking for another hotel to stay in because we were leaving asap and we did. I will never ever in my life go there again. It is horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't thrilled but it was cheap so I guess you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cruisers24
Reviews.Content: We came 2 days before our cruise. There were 3 of us in one room and 5 in the other. They were different floor plans. One of our bedrooms had no TV and no dresser. No hangers in the whole place although the other room did. They had coffee pots but no coffee. Our door was wide open when we got there up on the 29th floor which the elevator called the Penthouse. We were excited til we saw the room. The floor seemed dirty and there was no roll away bed like we had reserved and none available so our 5th person had to sleep on the sofa which was comfortable but not long enough and the bedding was gross. Later we went down for a drink in the lounge and had a lovely & very friendly barmaid (Jenny) who made our stay very pleasant. But when we got back to the room after we had requested more towells, the door was open again. That made me nervous. It is close to the monorail which is free and took us to Bayside Park in Biscayne Bay and we spent the day there. Lots to do & see there. The view was nice also. If you are concerned about money this might be the place but I've since heard many of the hotels are running pretty reasonable rates now because of the economy and maybe we should have done a little more research. The front desk person we dealt with was very unfriendly. But she was alone and it was rather busy when we checked in which was pretty late in the evening. Again, Jenny really made our stay. Hugged us when we left and we will never forget her.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre mediocre mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Swisserman
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the basic amenities found in a hotel. The facilities were clean...ish. The rooms offered the minimum comfort (good enough for an overnight sleep). The front desk clerks were not necessarily friendly but were efficient. Nevertheless the valet and the waiteresses at the restaurant were friendly. Some weird people that I believe were not guests of the hotel were just hanging out at the reception.The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood but wouldn't recommend staying there without a car.Moneywise can't complain got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, ask for a manager at once, don't let them tell you your room is not ready!”
Reviews.Author: mayflowers56
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an experience!!! I book this hotel 6 months in advance, was guaranteed a suite for six people. Arrived from the airport at 2:30pm, was told our room wasn't ready yet, and again verified that it was a suite with 2 baths, 1 queen bed, 2 twin beds & a hide a bed sofa. We went to lunch came back at 3:30 (ck in started a 3). Was told that they did not have a room for us (new desk clerk). After much discussion was given a suite. Found it was unbelievable dirty, only 2 beds, no sofa bed. At that point one of us had to pick up the rest of our party at the airport. I stayed behind & asked for a manager. While waiting I had talked with other guests that I knew, found that they had arrived & been upgraded from single suites to double suites & there were just 2 people in each. Watched as other people complained & actually left. After 1 hour wait finally talked with manager, again was told no more rooms were available, even though I had reserved 6 months ago. Then she finally gave us a room that was next to the filthy one. Unbelievably it was a pretty nice suite. It was a little worse for wear, but considering the one before it was acceptable. The rest of our party arrived, by then I had one fantastic headache. All that I can say if you stay here arrive before 1pm, don't let them tell you your room is not ready yet, if it isn't ask for a manager right away. Check the room out!!! If you bring a car it is $20 a day for their parking, they have you on that because there is no parking anywhere in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your time or money!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelR
Reviews.Content: (I stayed here on business prior to the SuperBowl.) I got to my room and had no phone & the air conditioner was broken (and stuck at 78 degrees!). After letting the front desk know, they supposedly sent someone to fix the situation. Although, it seemed a bit cooler the next night (74 degrees), I woke up in a sweat the following 2 mornings. I asked to change rooms, and was told, there were no vacancies. I also had an alarm system in my room (didn't make me feel very comfortable), considering there was a fulltime guard at the elevator and you have to swipe a tag, just to get on the elevator. The bed - oh, where do I begin? It was about 10 inches tall (from the floor), felt like a concrete block, the sheets were scratchy (but clean). My room was not "stocked" (snacks, and NO COFFEE, although I had a coffee maker) until the day I left. I guess the price was a "deal" for Miami (about $120), and they lure you in with the thought of a "luxury condo hotel". I'm confused at the positive ratings, all I can say is these people must not have traveled much. I would never stay here again. Do not waste your time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Would recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: klee_baker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only one night when i visited Miami for a few days. I had booked a 1 bedroomed appartment, and when we got there checked in & were upgraded to a 2 bedroomed one - the room itself was gorgeous!! The hotel is easy enough to find, and when we got there it seemed that the only parking opportunity was valet parking which they add to the cost of the room - this is charged at $20 per night and it allowed us to come and go as we pleased during this time (I was happy with this). You are given a key and a fob that you need to use in order to call the elevator - this is for securit as it is a tower of condos. Our room was on the 22nd floor so up we went. I opened the door to the room and was astounded by it - the door opened into the living room area which as attached to the balcony & had a fantasic view. The kitcchen was to the right, and this was where our 2nd Bedroom (and bathroom) was. To the left was a dining area and the master bedroom (with ensuite). All rooms had a fantasic bay view! The room was very clean, and had all equipment that we would need should we be stayiing there for more than a night - washer/dryer, microwave, cooker, fridge, cutler, dinnerware etc. We asked the lady on reception if she knew if the hard rock cafe was local (we thought it was but did not have any directions with us). She gladly went online & printed them off for us. We then drove to the local shopping / dining area called 'Bayside' which again was lovely - it overlooked the bay and seemed a nice place to go for some food and some drinks. My boyfriend used the pool and gym area and was impressed by both. They also offered breakfast in the restaurant if you wanted (for a surcharge) I think that the hotel was about a 15-20 min drive from South Beach (maybe longer with traffic) but close enough to go over there if needed for nights out etc. This was a great stay, and I'd 100% recommend it to friends, family and other travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price--wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lizzard48
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days while waiting for our cruise. We were so tired when we got to Miami that we went straight to the Fortune House Condos. Our room was not ready even though we were 2 hours early they gave us another room. We were so surprised at the room. It was 2 full bedrooms and 2 full baths with a really nice kitchen fully stocked with all manner of appliance and cooking ware. We were on the 26th floor with a view ( Biscayne Bay) to die for. We spent much of our time on the balcony. 2 TV's with cable and free WiFi. The gym and pool are very nice and open from 6-10pm. The downstairs cafe was not much, but there is a wonderful Argentenian restraunt about 1 block called Novecento and a really nice deli that serves all day just across from Novecento's. The location of this hotel is about 2 block from the People mover which can take you to all the shopping downtown. This was a really great deal and I would come back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Theauthorcrwl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the fortune house for a day prior to going on a cruise. We had four different rooms... The first room which was our room was ok compared to the other rooms. Besides the old couch we had no tv's in the bedrooms and the toliets in the bathrooms did not work. We called the front desk to have someone fix them but no one ever came. Luckily we were able to use the bathrooms in our families room. It was an inconvience but we managed.The layout of the room was spacious and the view was nice. BUT...as you go up floors and we saw our other family rooms there rooms was much better. Hardwood floors, flat screen tv's in each room, CD playe, marble counters. Very nice room. So my recommendation is to make sure you verify the type of room you are getting prior to staying there. Parking is an extra cost per night so be prepared for parking because there is no parking around the hotel. The restuarant food was gross and make sure that you verify that breakfast is included in your stay (if you chose to eat there). There is also nothing around the hotel but more hotels and office business.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FeminineEssence
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were at the Fortune house for about three days. We had the bay view two bedroom condo and it was o.k. The queen bed was very comfortable but the twin beds in the other room were not comfortable. Everyone ended up breaking out in bug bites from the blankets. There is a washer and dryers for you to wash and bleach your sheets in order to fight the bugs off ...other then that the place was o.k. I like the free internet use , the gym was great, the housekeeper only came once out of the three days we were there(not good) I like the valet parking ,the location wasn't bad at all. I advice you to have a GPS to take you everywhere but the beach was only 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Close1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in april 2009 at Fortune House, Our room was very c lean and Comfortable, we had clean services every day, clean white towels, i used the kitchen a lot cause is very convenience to do breakfast or light lunnch, there is a supermakert walking distance, the gym is amazing, hot tub bit small for the hotel size, parking area was a trouble, when we registered was $25 per 24 hours, when we left they reduced the price to $5 really good for the brickell area. the location was good, closed to downtown and miami arena, there is a free metro train at short distance for easy acces to downtown. i would recomend fortune house, really good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay at this hotel or recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjanae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on March 13- 15, 2009. There are no amenities, house keepers leave at 5:00 P.M., the lay out is okay, however, the bathroom sink and tub was dirty, the kitchen counters were dirty, the air system did not work well and there was a bad odor in the room. They also have dirty walls and poor painting jobs throughout the rooms. There is No television in the bedroom. I asked for someone to clean my bathroom sink at 9:30 Saturday because it was dirty when I had checked in the day before and had to call again at 4:00 P.M. when I returned from my day out. Food options are very limited they have a cafe not real restaurant. If you are looking for an apartment and your standards are not to high then good luck. It has potential, if they put more effort in being clean. I put a towel on the couch before I laid down on it, not that there was spots, I was just concern after seeing how dirty the bathroom sink and tub were.

Reviews.Title: “Our take on this property”
Reviews.Author: LeoLadyUpperMidwest
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by bidding. Four of us stayed here 2 days, pre-cruise in late Jan. It had what we needed, 2 B.rooms, (1 King, 1 full), 2 baths. Also a full sized kitchen, w/everything, and a small washer/dryer that worked well. Our view was fantastic, but there are others that are not so nice. This property is just like any condo rental anywhere, you take a chance, we got a clean, modern unit and would definitely stay there again. Front desk people were just fine. Small pool area was clean, small work-out gym, also ok. Near Metro mover & we used it easily. Walking distance to a Publix grocery and Walgreens. Near great Italian restaurant, Perrigrinos, try it! We were concerned because of previous reviews but for the 4 of us, it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDivingNut
Reviews.Content: Needed to travel to Miami on short notice for a business trip - economy being what it is - opted for the Fortune House at $105/night instead of the JW Marriott for $264/night. Very odd experience for travelers used to the main stream hotels - it's a condo with key fob security access. There is a sign on the valet parking booth that says Guests $5/24 hours. Guests however must pay $20/24 hours. The room was well worn, stains on the carpet, scuffed up walls, not grossly dirty but not clean either - looked like it was cleaned by someone who didn't care. Nicely equipped workout center, restaurant downstairs with typically high pricing. Staff was friendly enough - didn't go out of their way to be inviting but not rude. Would think twice - three times - before staying here again. Even with the bad economy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRMX9
Reviews.Content: Despite some of the comments here I could not praise the Fortune House more highly in terms of value, location and quality of accommodation. Arrived very late at night and check in was very straightforward. Had booked a 1 bed executive apartment on the upper floors which was very clean and had all the facilities you would need - cable TV in lounge and bedroom, microwave, fridge freezer, washer and drier. There is also a good (free) gym with sauna and the outside pool (open until midnight) also had a nice spa as well. Hotel is also well located for those travelling without a car - its only 1 block from the Financial District metromover station (gets you into central Miami in 5 minutes and makes getting to Miami beach easier too as you can catch a bus from the Omni station at the end of the line). There is also a Publix supermarket and Walgreens five mins away which is good if you want to buy/cook your own food - and lots of banks as well (incl an HSBC next door which came in handy when I had problems with my bank card). Its not the Four Seasons of course (across the road) - its a quarter of the price per night and you get a full kitchen and washing facilities!!

Reviews.Title: “No Empathy”
Reviews.Author: litchfieldbrandy
Reviews.Content: I was talking to a friend who is planing to visit the Miami area and I was telling her about my experience and she suggested this site to share my story. My husband and I went to visit our son and his wife they just had a new baby, my first grand child. We planned to stay for a month. We booked the Fortune House because it was the most convenient. On one of our earlier visits we looked at the Hotel and thought the lobby was very nice and noticed that there is a 24 hour security desk. We thought the rooms would be just as lovely. We had the most rotten time staying in the unit they gave us. The view was good but the room was so awful and smells as if it hadn't been cleaned for months. There were no towels in the bathroom. The bed was not made there were no sheets or blankets on it. The pillows had no pillow cases on them. I called the desk for bed linens and towels and was told I had to come to the desk for them. The floors needed vacuuming, the washer/dryer did not work. The washer had standing water in it when we checked in. There were loose wires hanging from the bedroom, bathroom and living room ceilings. There were no TV remote control and they said they didn't have any to give me till the next day. By the way, this is not a cheap hotel. It is located in a very nice part of Miami. I asked for another room and they told me they did not have any more rooms. So we had to stay in that awful room. In eight days I checked out. At check-out I expressed my experience but there were no apologies or compensations, basically, just an I don't care attitude. I am not saying the entire Hotel is awful but the room I had was truly awful and the staff did not seem to care. The manager and staff showed no empathy.

Reviews.Title: “bugs and dirty”
Reviews.Author: jmandak
Reviews.Content: bed bugs-black bugs --in the bed under the sheets and the housekeepers were not surprised and they did nothing to help the situation. silverfish in the bathrooms. dirt and grime on all kitchen counters and tables. dirty floors For $111.00 plus tax, it seems good for 2BR and 2 Baths, kitchen and terrace. Bring your own bug spray and windex and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: This condo hotel is a good value for the price. I stayed there 5 nights for 109 USD a night. Where else can you find a two rooms ( with two TV, an american kitchen and a sofa) in Miami pricey Financial district ?. They have free Internet, a luggage room where I left my suitcases for two weeks when I left to go to Orlando. The staff members is friendly and all. The hotel is well located close to many restaurants a walking distance from Miami's loop, banks and other hotels such as the Four seasons where you need at least 3 times the price to stay. I have had a clean room and everything went smooth. On top of that, I had had a credit card problem in another part of Florida. by mistake, a rental shop Manager had charged a high amount on my card so that the card was not accepted anywhere so I could not provide a guarantee in all the hotels I went. Everywhere I went, I received the same answer : NO credit card, no room. Fortune House is the only place where they waive the need for a credit card. They made me pay the room in advance without taking a credit card. They were life saver for a European man in the States with no credit card. I recommend this place very much !!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Well Priced, but FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: eeva1
Reviews.Content: we booked a 2 room suite for 2 days... On expedia it stated that you would get 2 bedrooms with queen sized beds and a sofa bed in the living room.... Instead master bedroom w/ queen sized bed w/ master bath attatched, a small children's bedroom w/ a double bed and a small love seat w/ no pull out... this did not work very well as there were 2 couples and a friend of ours who drove from west palm beach and was hoping to sleep on a sofe bed ended up sleeping on a love seat..... the kitchen advertised was big however there were absolutely no cutlery, glasses, pots or pan...Room service was useless and did not speak english very well..... the worst part of it all is that the room was filthy... the floors looked like they haven't been mopped in months and the bath tub mouldings were molding....they clean your room every second day and all they really do is change your towels I don't even think they wipped any thing down..

Reviews.Title: “Better then Average :-)”
Reviews.Author: THEJAILER
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Fortune House Hotel earlier this week. The check in was fast and easy. The desk staff as well as the Security staff (Yes, They have their own security which is nice :-) were always nice and willing to help with any questions I had. The Reservations Department were also professional at all times. I had a one bedroom executive suite with a city view which was nice. I wont lie and say it was perfect as it was not. This condo showed some wear and tear but did serve our needs well and I did get a great last minute rate on this condo. If I had paid $350.00 a night, I would be FAR MORE vocal not that the Hotel itself is not nice enough as it is, But this unit #1213 would have had to have a make over for that kind of $.. But as I stated I didnt pay that and myself and my lady felt the room was fine. The only thing I missed on this property was on on-site lounge to go down and relax or have a night cap. Their is a deli in the lobby that sells beer and wine to take up stairs to your condo but it's not the same.. Another "BIG" plus for this Hotel is for you people with nice cars to worry about. The Fortune House has a Gated indoor garage with Security guards in it which can only be opened with a sensor on your room key. VERY NICE for me as I had a 2008 Covette rental car which once you enter the garage you realize that the residents of this Condo /Hotel have even nicer cars then that and don't have any problems and I did not either while I stayed there..For another good rate, I would not think twice about staying again at the Fortune House as it was just a few minute ride to everything and away from the hustle of the Beach crowd. I enjoyed my stay and hope to stay again in the Future.

Reviews.Title: “Fortune for the Fortune House”
Reviews.Author: TeeGee99
Reviews.Content: Fortune House is a condo hotel. Furniture is like dorm-room style with a couch that was on a metal frame with stained removable cushions. No amenities. No services. No wireless Internet in the rooms (only the lobby). Hotel was relatively safe and room was clean. Bed was cheap. No TV in the bedroom -- only the living room. Would not want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Scottilla
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews of this hotel make valid points, but put it all together, and you get a better experience than the sum of its parts. The building is a condominium, where some of the owners rent out their apartments when they're not using them. As such, some of the furniture is old, and could use replacement. The housekeeping is OK, the place isn't spotless, but considering the staff size (I think there is one housekeeper), the apartment was clean. We were on the 25th floor, but didn't have much of a view, because we were at the side of the building, but we were above the pool, and if you looked out over the edge of the terrace, you could see the ocean. The location is in a business district, so on the weekend it was very quiet. It was a block from the free downtown subway, which took us to the entertainment district and Bayside Marketplace, and also connected to Metro Rail and Tri Rail. The parking ($16 per day) was convenient with elevator access. The front desk and concierge were very helpful and friendly. There is a lot of security, I'm not sure how much of it is necessary, but you need your key card to get into the front door, on the elevator or into the garage, and again from the garage to the elevator. I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would use the public transportation even more now that I know how it works.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mvn2Fst
Reviews.Content: when staying here you must keep in mind that every unit is own by someone different, so not all units are exactly the same. Fortunatly when we went in April we had a great unit on the 16th floor. No complaints at all, I guess its the luck of the draw, so if you get a bad unit, request another one its just that simple. Internet center was perfect, nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: nununy
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to let people know that we found this to be a perfectly fine place to stay. We were worried after reading some of the reviews here! We were in a two bedroom, two bath suite for four people (ages 25-58). We were in for 2 nights and 2 days for a wedding. The beds were comfortable, the place was clean. It was great to have a kitchen and dining table where we had breakfast and snacks. The living room had a comfortable couch and chair. There was a patio with a beautiful view. When a smoke alarm battery ran out and was chirping, a serviceman came to fix it in a timely manner. We were given clean towels. The staff was nice. If we were in Miami again we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not very good, but not very bad”
Reviews.Author: annie235
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night after a cruise and it was not what we expected. The room was definately run down. When I sat on the couch I thought that I was going to fall through to the floor. Another thing, the main reason that I chose the place was because the description said that there was a pool and whirlpool. There were, but unfortunately they neglected to tell us that they were not usable because of a plumbing problem. Another problem was that none of the taxi drivers knew where the place was. Its best to see if the consierge will call them for you but they are a little less than helpful. Overall, it wasn't entirely bad. The place was clean and the showers were hot and had good water pressure. There was also a balcony but all that was good for was to lust over the pool and amenities over at the four seasons. I would not stay there again. The price was right but I plan to splurge a little the next time.

Reviews.Title: “No value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: FALCOR
Reviews.Content: Room #912---Broken bedroom window blinds; not one decorative item in the bedroom (no pictures, no mirrors, no wallpaper or paint (other than white wallboard); double bed not a queen size as advertised; thread-bare material for sheets and a dirty bedspread; no coffee filters; filthy bathroom with black ring around the tub; old mattress that sags in the middle; bed frame squeaks when changing position; deodorizer used in the carpet so strong it was a distraction.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Deroney
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short ; if this is the place you've chosen to stay be prepared. For what ? Cabbies who can't find the place, ( while your cab fare spirals upward), promises of receiving an "upgraded" room (?!), dirt and grime everywhere, and an early morning wake-up call consisting of 100 decibel hammering . The icing on the cake is that the cabbies can't find the place to pick you up when you're ready to leave either! ( There were at least 10 separate parties waiting outside the FH when we went outside to hail a cab . Some had been there 45 minutes . There was almost a fight when one guy thought we were taking "his" cab). I AM NOT a snooty hotel patron. As a matter of fact this is the first time I've ever written a review on the internet for anything. The good news was that we SAW no bugs , but the atmosphere was conducive to harboring the entire Wild Kingdom. Still ,. the gross fingerprints smeared all over the walls were a constant reminder of the sty in which we were staying . We only stayed here since the Super Bowl was in town and there were NO other hotels available. We were trying to get on a cruise ship the following AM. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Condo in Brickell”
Reviews.Author: Kimber_jewel
Reviews.Content: This is an ok place to stay if you need to be on the Downtown side of Miami. If you plan to visit Miami Beach often during your trip, don't book here - taxis are nearly $25 one way to Ocean Drive. But if you are looking for something in a good safe location downtown, the Fortune House is a pretty good choice. Located less than a block from a free metro mover station that has a connection to the metro rail. Secure building in a safe part of Miami. There are not many resturants or bars near by and at night the neighborhood turns into a ghost town. The condo itself was large enough for 1-2 people. The kitchen offered anything you would need for a week stay. The bedroom was actually quit large and the balcony was a nice retreat after a days work. The staff was very helpful, held our bags after check out. There is a business center with free internet access in the lobby. The reason for the lower rating is because during our stay the pool was closed the entire time, the building also consist of residential condos and you could hear dog barks echoing through out the halls at random times through out the night, and the condo was only surface clean.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Stay”
Reviews.Author: my3boysandme
Reviews.Content: In late November, my family and I booked a one-night-stay at the Fortune House in Miami. We found it on the internet and were excited that it was all suites (our 3 kids and mother-in-law) were traveling with us. It was also within minutes to the Port of Miami where we were to board our ship the next day. This was no doubt, the dirtiest room we have ever stayed in. Our boys socks were beyond black from walking on the carpet, there was two inches of dust in the bedroom ceiling and ceiling fan, and the a/c return unit was clogged with dust. When I phoned downstairs to the front desk and suggested the room needed cleaning, the attendant said the maid service had until late evening to complete the cleaning. Well, maid service never showed up. Someone needs to report management to the health department. Did I mention my seven year old found dog poop in the living room area?

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem of Miami”
Reviews.Author: ValerieD
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was quite nervous to stay at a lower priced hotel. We needed to be close to the port as we were heading out the next day for our cruise, and I hated the idea of spending $150+ before I'd even gotten on the boat. To make it even more stressful, I'd never been to Miami. SO...I thought, based on the reviews, Fortune House had just as high (and in most cases a higher) rating. All I could do was make an educated guess and hope my thriftiness hadn't gotten me in trouble again. The taxis at MIA seemed to be well regulated, so the attendants let us know that it was in the downtown area and that would cost around $25 (about 20 minutes away). We ended up spending about $29 as the city's street signage wasn't all that clear and our driver had never heard of Fortune House. Turns out, it was directly across the street from the Four Seasons. Looking out the window of a cab you can't always see much looking up, which is where the signage was (so don't drive past the Four Seasons or you've gone too far, and then start looking up at the front of the buildings...I think it was a soft pink color). We pulled in just around 9:30pm Saturday night and right away the valet was there to open the door for us. He buzzed us in (yay! I already felt safe) and we walked in to a marble-filled room. The receptionist was friendly and welcoming. Before we could even get our bags in she asked my name and before I could finish my first name she was saying my last. It was like they were waiting for me (not bad for $92 bucks =) ! She quickly went over the amenities (pool/spa, deli downstairs, internet access, etc) and handed us our key which also had a magnetic key to give us access to the elevators. When we went down the halls I looked for signs of construction as I remembered comments from reviews I'd read, but everything looked new. This place is super-spacious!!! It is straight-up an apartment. My mom and I were just going to share a bed so we had the 1-room unit. But the kitchen had a dishwasher, pots/dishes/et al, and a full washer/dryer. The patio was more for stepping out for some fresh air, not for laying out on a lawn chair and having a BBQ. The living room had a nice-size TV and a stereo system. I could tell that they weren't finished updating the bathroom (so no luxury here) but it wasn't dirty. The bedroom was simple, but more than adequate. It had a walk in closets and full ironing board. This was definately set-up for guests needing to stay a while. So what didn't I like? Well, I didn't bring a car so I didn't have to deal with the "high cost" parking some lamented, but even though there are tons of hotels nearby (Marriott Courtyard, etc) there aren't really any places to walk to for a quick bite. You'd do best to order in pizza, unless you want to spend big bucks at the neighboring hotels' restaurants or catch a cab to a restaurant. Their deli was almost closed (but it was almost 11pm I think) and the items that they sold (carton of eggs, jug of milk, etc. since the sandwich items were already put up) weren't what we were looking for and the snacks were kind of costly. Oh, they did have a mini bar, so you wouldn't starve if you just had to eat something from the room (they had CupNoodles, M&Ms, Pringles, and other snacks). I did see a grocery store from our balcony, but I only would've went there if I'd been staying longer. Remeber, we were just passing through, not sightseeing. When we checked out, the receptionists were really friendly, patiently answered our tourist questions, gave us great advice about the port and boarding, and called us taxi. It cost us about $12 to get to the port which was about 3.5 miles away (less than 10 minutes). Overall, I wasn't looking for a resort-like Ritz Carlton enviornment, but I didn't plan to pay almost $100 for a cheap motel. My friends who stayed in South Beach or the Marriott down from us for a few days before our cruise left Miami, were all mad that they'd spent so much money for hotels that weren't "all that." Fortune House is definitely a perfectly good place to stay. I'm telling all my cruising buddies!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: shan2551
Reviews.Content: This has to be the absolute worst place I have ever stayed at. Don't be fooled by the beautiful pictures they show on the internet. It looks nice when you first check in, but that is where it stops. Our room was filthy! There was hair all over the bathroom floor, a substance that looked like dried blood on one of the tables, hair all in our sheets, and food in the couch. We tried several times to have the situation corrected, but we were given the run around. When we told the front desk the room was not clean we were told that housekeeping told them it was clean so it must be. We even asked the woman behind the desk to come and look at our room, but she told us she could not leave. We ended up getting clean sheets, after waiting for over an hour, but we had to change them ourselves. All of my attempts to contact the hotel management have gotten me nowhere. I am always told the manager is not available, or in a meeting. She also has not returned any of the phone messages I have left. Please do yourself a favor and save yourself a lot of aggravation: Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “O.K. but not great”
Reviews.Author: auscan
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant booking the FH after reading all the reviews. Overall I had an o.k. stay, I was there because I had some business meetings in the area. The biggest problem for me was that there was not Internet connection in the room. They have wireless in the Business center on the Ground Floor but it if you need to work a lot it is a little inconvinient. The room was big, but there is no TV in the bedroom, the kitchen area was well stoked. I found some mold in the bathroom but after I complained at the Front Desk they took care of it. The pool area could need some work, the pool is o.k but the lounge chairs are in need for a makover, missing straps and dirty. Overall I would say you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “better than average...not by much though”
Reviews.Author: dbrochyu
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the room that we requested but we did get a room just as nice. They didn't tell us we were getting a different room, they just hoped we wouldn't complain. I requested a 2-room condo with 4 queen beds, I was given a 2-room condo with one queen bed and 2 sets of bunk beds. Good thing it was just a bunch of young college friends and not older couples; twin bunk beds don't usually work for older couples. Most of the hallways were under construction. The rooms in each condo were on the small side as well as the kitchen. The living room was nice with leather couches and a balcony. Dining room had pretty chairs. Be careful when walking out to the balcony though the sliding glass door has a 3inch lip that i tripped on walking out to the balcony. I don't know if that is on all rooms, but it was in mine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for Long Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovesit13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fortune House for several weeks. The place was been under "renovation" the entire time. No one made this clear to me when I booked the hotel. Nor did anyone explain why a 4 year old hotel needed renovation. But the renovation did create exposed vents, unpainted walls, lumber and wood in the hallway, and loud construction during the day. The staff was friendly, but less than helpful in certain ways. Do not confuse them with a concierge. The answer to everything is "I don't know". This hotel has no internet access. The so-called "Business Center" has cheap wireless that barely works within 2 feet. Small things went untended like a lightbulb burning out or my requests for fixing the microwave, etc. The neighborhood is safe but eerily silent. This place is not good for a long-term, business trip. But its probably okay for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: NathMtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fortune hotel just before heading on a cruise. Our experience at this place was WOW! We did not expect such a room, sorry ..appartment. We were 2 girlfriends, so we had a 2 bedrooms appartment, 2 bathrooms (great for 2 girls right?), a kitchen, large sitting and dining area, a balcony overlooking the swimming pool. The place is also a condo lot, so some of the residents did hang out on the pool late at night for a BBQ, but no big deal. Not noisy. I think the pool closes at 12.00am. We were on the 16th floor which was going under renovations. We stayed over on a Saturday night so cannot tell you if it noisy during week days. Location : not that fun. It is in the business quarter, so we walked to Bayfront park, where you have lots of restaurants, bars, boutiques.. About 45 mns walk. But one of the people mover station is not far away. And it is FREE!. There is a small deli just down near the lobby and the lady there is such a sweetheart. You can grab breakfast, large salads or else there. Swimming pool is nice and tidy. Staff at front desk are so, so. But it seems like they are all the same in Miami. I recommend the Fortune to anyone. I would certainly stay there again if I'd return to Miami

Reviews.Title: “Nice For The Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Fortune house because being situated in the Financial district of Miami it was close to the embassy building on 8th St. where we had business to conduct. (Most embassies - Brazil, Japan many more) are located in a single building nearby). It is also fairly close to Miami Beach and Key Biscayne by car. The lobby was nice and the receptionist polite and efficient. Our online reservation was complete and parking ($8.00 a day extra) was available in the lower floors of the building with convenient access to the elevator to our room on the 24th floor. The 24th floor was undergoing renovation so there was some construction noise starting about 8:00 AM. Our 3 1/2 room apartment was clean, the furniture fairly new. Access to the balcony was restricted by the broken vertical blinds. At 1:30 in the morning a fairly large wall painting in the bedroom fell off the wall to the floor, scaring us badly. It was hung by a thin nail in the plasterboard and the plasterboard gave way. On the other hand the room was quiet, the kitchen stocked with utensils, the bath was clean and the water plentiful. Given the price you pay (about $75 daily including parking) and the proximity to Miami beach the Fortune House is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for my needs”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: Well, after booking this accommodations for 1 night, I was very concerned after reading the reviews, but I must say, I was very comfortable with the place, for the PRICE I paid for it. One has to take into account, the area and your needs when booking and then your expectations. I required somewhere close to the French Embassy/ Financial district and every other hotel with walking distance was over 275.00 per night. I managed to get 1 night accommodations at this facility for 124.00 per night on expedia with taxes (143.13) and I was very happy. Why? because; 1. I was within 1 block of the French Embassy (3 mins walk) 2. The room was spacious enough for myself, with a kitchen - I did not need but it also had a washer/dryer and a large walk-in closet. 3. Staff was accomodating, I had to check in early (without prior notice) and it was handled very well. 4. Parking was safe and easy (NB. expensive as with everywhere else $16.00 per day taxes included) 5. wide variety of TV/ cable channels to choose from. (plenty spanish stations- I guess because its MIA) Cons: 1. The bed is average along with it small pillows and ugly comforter 2. bathroom average. not as bad as some report, but does need some work, in terms of decor 3. noisy a/c 4. waiting to see how long they hold the deposit on my card. 5. difficult to make overseas calls from the room. This place may not be for everyone, but it surely is a good deal for the location, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonable price in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay before cruise”
Reviews.Author: brianl_s
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time with this condo/suite after I booked it and then finding either bad reviews or not enough reviews/old reviews. I actually attempted to get out of staying there. Since it was around spring break this task was impossible and we did end up staying here for one night before we left on our cruise. The location is excellent; it sits in an upscale part of downtown Miami (Brickell area - financial district). There is some construction going on but easy to look past. Lot's of very nice condos going up around here....we took a nice walk to the semi-arch on Biscayne bay and could see the cruise ships. Our one bedroom suite was on the 26 floor, ceramic tiles almost throughout, nice furniture in great room, full kitchen (we didn't really need), great views from balcony, bedroom was nice and entire place was clean. Front desk was courteous and efficient. The bagel barn downstairs has decent food for a quick breakfast. This condo/suite may not be suited for the business traveler who needs many amenities and services but I found everything I needed and more. Also, they had late checkout (noon) and when I went down to checkout I asked them to call a cab to go to the terminal. By the time I checked out (which consisted of giving them my key) a cab was already out front waiting for me. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine52
Reviews.Content: March 17th, 2006 We spent one night at the Fortune House before taking a cruise the next day. The condo was very clean and service at the front desk was very good. Linen was clean. Two bedroom condo with two bathrooms. Nice clean kitchen and appliances all in good shape. Very comfortable. Internet services and beautiful fitness center. Beautiful view from any window. I will definitely return there when we go on another cruise and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “It took alot of work and worry”
Reviews.Author: dalme53654
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hotel through Hotwire before Christmas after realizing that all the cheaper hotels in Miami were gone for the date I needed. My family was going on a cruise and I needed just one night in Miami. I had never been to Miami before and was already spending a fortune in limos', transportation and decided to stay in downtown Miami for the convience to the Port. After purchasing this thru Hotwire and then reading the reviews, I was horrified but realized that there wasn't anything I could do. I kept on reading more reviews that weren't good so I called Hotwire and spoke with them. They basically said they can't do anything. Great!! A week before our trip another bad reivew so I called the hotel myself and spoke to them about my serious concerns. THen I called hotwire again and this time they said that since I had found 3 different sources with bad reviews, I could cancel my reservation . That's great I said but everything left in Miami is now over $400 and up - no good. I kept the reservation and went down with worry. Upon checkin, they remembered me and my conversation and went overboard trying to be nice. The lobby is beautiful and the place is clean. We had a one bedroom that was clean and no problems at all. The front desk was very helpful with getting taxi's for us and getting us xtra towels and bedding for the pullout couch(that should have been there to begin with). Would I stay here again- probably not but for one night it was certainly fine and the hotel did their best to assure us and make our stay the best it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julyernie
Reviews.Content: The first night we had a 2 bedroom condo with kitchen that was was void of all utensils etc. Items were requested but we were advised the unit is "as is". The next night they put us in a one bedroom condo that was better equiped but mildew in the bathroom was unacceptable. Plus in the morning we realized we did not have a coffee maker so breakfast was out of the question. For $229. per night we should have had better service. We will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not what you think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i expected to be pampered. first of all they are doing so much construction around the area the cab was lost for almost 20 minutes. When we finally arrived at the hotel we learned that the hotel property amenities weren't on the property. the pool, sauna, and jacuzzi wasn't working. to top it off we had to carry our own luggage. well i asked to cancel my reservations in order to stay at another hotel in south beach. yes i was charged penalty fees on top of that. the spa was at the four seasons hotel and not at fortune house

HotelInfo.Name: Fortune House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 185 SE 14 Terrace, Miami, FL 33131
